cards.name: Absolute Grace
cards.text: All creatures have protection from black.
cards.flavor: In pursuit of Urza, the Phyrexians sent countless foul legions into Serra's realm. Though beaten back, they left it tainted with uncleansable evil.

cards.name: Absolute Law
cards.text: All creatures have protection from red.
cards.flavor: The strength of law is unwavering. It is an iron bar in a world of water.

cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Abyssal Horror
cards.text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: It has no face of its own—it wears that of its latest victim.

cards.name: Academy Researchers
cards.text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.

cards.name: Acidic Soil
cards.text: Acidic Soil deals damage to each player equal to the number of lands he or she controls.
cards.flavor: Phyrexia had tried to take Urza's soul. He was relieved that Shiv tried to claim only his soles.

cards.name: Acridian
cards.text: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: The elves of Argoth were trained to ride these creatures, even when their mounts traveled upside-down.

cards.name: Albino Troll
cards.text:
Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: If you're smaller than the anaconda, it considers you food. If you're larger than the anaconda, it considers you a lot of food.

cards.name: Angelic Chorus
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor: The very young and the very old know best the song the angels sing.

cards.name: Angelic Page
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its bearers.

cards.name: Annul
cards.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.
cards.flavor: The most effective way to destroy a spell is to ensure it was never cast in the first place.

cards.name: Antagonism
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, Antagonism deals 2 damage to that player unless one of his or her opponents was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Arc Lightning
cards.text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

cards.name: Arcane Laboratory
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor: It soon became obvious that some experiments were best overseen by fireproof teachers.

cards.name: Argothian Elder
cards.text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
cards.flavor:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning "grow wiser"

cards.name: Argothian Enchantress
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Argothian Swine
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: In Argoth, the shortest path between two points is the one the swine make.

cards.name: Argothian Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Argothian Wurm enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice a land. If a player does, put Argothian Wurm on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Attunement
cards.text: Return Attunement to its owner's hand: Draw three cards, then discard four cards.
cards.flavor:
"The solution can hide for only so long."
—Urza

cards.name: Back to Basics
cards.text: Nonbasic lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"A ruler wears a crown while the rest of us wear hats, but which would you rather have when it's raining?"
—Barrin, Principia

cards.name: Barrin's Codex
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Barrin's Codex.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Barrin's Codex: Draw X cards, where X is the number of page counters on Barrin's Codex.

cards.name: Barrin, Master Wizard
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge is no more expensive than ignorance, and at least as satisfying."
—Barrin, master wizard

cards.name: Bedlam
cards.text: Creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: Sometimes quantity, in the absence of quality, is good enough.

cards.name: Befoul
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The land putrefied at its touch, turned into an oily bile in seconds."
—Radiant, archangel

cards.name: Bereavement
cards.text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Grief is as useless as love."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor:
"Braid her branches, life fulfilling
Goddess loving, Goddess killing."
—Citanul chant

cards.name: Blanchwood Treefolk
cards.flavor: The massive Argivian attack on their rooted kindred was a declaration of war to the treefolk.

cards.name: Blasted Landscape
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Blood Vassal
cards.text: Sacrifice Blood Vassal: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"They are bred to suffer and born to die. Much like humans."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Bog Raiders
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Let weak feed on weak, that we may divine the nature of strength."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

cards.name: Brand
cards.text:
Gain control of all permanents you own. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor:
"By this glyph I affirm your role."
—Urza, to Karn

cards.name: Bravado
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"We drive the dragons from our home. Why should we fear you?"
—Fire Eye, viashino bey

cards.name: Breach
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Brilliant Halo
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
When Brilliant Halo is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Brilliant Halo to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk
cards.flavor:
"How could you not hear it approach? It's a hippo!"
—Argivian commander

cards.name: Bulwark
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Bulwark deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: "It will be the goblin's first bath, and its last." —Fire Eye, viashino bey

cards.name: Cackling Fiend
cards.text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.

cards.name: Carpet of Flowers
cards.text: At the beginning of each of your main phases, if you haven't added mana to your mana pool with this ability this turn, you may add up to X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is the number of Islands target opponent controls.

cards.name: Carrion Beetles
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor: It's all fun and games until someone loses an eye.

cards.name: Catalog
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor:
"Without order comes errors, and errors kill on Tolaria."
—Barrin, master wizard

cards.name: Catastrophe
cards.text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

cards.name: Cathodion
cards.text: When Cathodion dies, add {3} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Instead of creating a tool that would be damaged by heat, the Thran built one that was charged by it.

cards.name: Cave Tiger
cards.text: Whenever Cave Tiger becomes blocked by a creature, Cave Tiger gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The druids found a haven in the cool limestone tunnels beneath Argoth. The invaders found only tigers.

cards.name: Child of Gaea
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Child of Gaea unless you pay {G}{G}.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Child of Gaea.

cards.name: Chimeric Staff
cards.text: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A snake in the grasp.

cards.name: Citanul Centaurs
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Echo {3}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

cards.name: Citanul Flute
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Citanul Hierophants
cards.text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: From deep in the caves beneath the forest, the hierophants planned the druids' raids against the enemy.

cards.name: Claws of Gix
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a permanent: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When the Brotherhood of Gix dug out the cave of Koilos they found their master's severed hand. They enshrined it, hoping that one day it would point the way to Phyrexia.

cards.name: Clear
cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Cloak of Mists
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"All we could lose, we did. All we could keep, we do. And both are shrouded by mists."
—Barrin, master wizard

cards.name: Confiscate
cards.text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor:
"I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit."
—Barrin, progress report

cards.name: Congregate
cards.text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

cards.name: Contamination
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Contamination unless you sacrifice a creature.
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type and amount.

cards.name: Copper Gnomes
cards.text: {4}, Sacrifice Copper Gnomes: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Start with eleven gnomes and a room of parts, and come morning you'll have ten and a monster the likes of which you've never seen.

cards.name: Coral Merfolk
cards.flavor: It is not unusual for a single family of coral merfolk to spend centuries carefully guiding the growth of the reefs where they make their home.

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: Yawgmoth brushed Urza's mind, and Urza's world convulsed.

cards.name: Cradle Guard
cards.text:
Trample
Echo {1}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor:
Mother, sleep / Dream our lives
Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

cards.name: Crater Hellion
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

cards.name: Crazed Skirge
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

cards.name: Crosswinds
cards.text: Creatures with flying get -2/-0.
cards.flavor: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.

cards.name: Crystal Chimes
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Crystal Chimes: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: As Serra was to learn, the peace and sanctity of her realm were as fragile as glass.

cards.name: Curfew
cards.text: Each player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: ". . . But I'm not tired!"

cards.name: Dark Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
When Dark Hatchling enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus The Grand Evolution began."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

cards.name: Darkest Hour
cards.text: All creatures are black.
cards.flavor:
"Yawgmoth spent eons wrapping Phyrexians in human skin. They are the sleeper agents, and they are everywhere."
—Xantcha, to Urza

cards.name: Defensive Formation
cards.text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.
cards.flavor:
"Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life."
—Song of All, canto 873

cards.name: Despondency
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.
When Despondency is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Despondency to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Destructive Urge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor: Red sky at night, dragon's delight.

cards.name: Diabolic Servitude
cards.text:
When Diabolic Servitude enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude dies, exile it and return Diabolic Servitude to its owner's hand.
When Diabolic Servitude leaves the battlefield, exile the creature put onto the battlefield with Diabolic Servitude.

cards.name: Disciple of Grace
cards.text:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Beauty is beyond law.

cards.name: Disciple of Law
cards.text:
Protection from red
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: A religious order for religious order.

cards.name: Discordant Dirge
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Discordant Dirge.
{B}, Sacrifice Discordant Dirge: Look at target opponent's hand and choose up to X cards from it, where X is the number of verse counters on Discordant Dirge. That player discards those cards.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Let Phyrexia breed evil in the darkness; my holy light will reveal its taint."
—Serra

cards.name: Disorder
cards.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Then, just when the other guys were winnin', the sky threw up."
—Jula, goblin raider

cards.name: Disruptive Student
cards.text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."
—Barrin, progress report

cards.name: Douse
cards.text: {1}{U}: Counter target red spell.
cards.flavor: The academy's libraries were protected by fire-prevention spells. Even after the disaster, the books were intact—though forever sealed in time.

cards.name: Dragon Blood
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Fire in the blood, fire in the belly.

cards.name: Drifting Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drifting Djinn unless you pay {1}{U}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Drifting Meadow
cards.text:
Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Dromosaur
cards.text: Whenever Dromosaur blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They say dromosaurs are frightened of dogs, even little ones. There are no dogs in Shiv. Not even little ones.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"We decide who is worthy of our works."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Eastern Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
cards.flavor:
"Their fragile world. Their futile lives. They obstruct the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall excise them."
—Oath of the East

cards.name: Electryte
cards.text: Whenever Electryte deals combat damage to defending player, it deals damage equal to its power to each blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Shivan inhabitants are hardened to fire, so their predators have developed alternative weaponry.

cards.name: Elite Archers
cards.text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Arrows fletched with the feathers of angels seldom miss their mark.

cards.name: Elvish Herder
cards.text: {G}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Before Urza and Mishra came to Argoth, the herders prevented their creatures from stampeding. During the war, they encouraged it.

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Enchantment Alteration
cards.text: Attach target Aura attached to a creature or land to another permanent of that type.

cards.name: Endless Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Endless Wurm unless you sacrifice an enchantment.
cards.flavor: Ages ago, a party of elves took cover to let one pass. They're still waiting.

cards.name: Endoskeleton
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Endoskeleton during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+3 for as long as Endoskeleton remains tapped.

cards.name: Energy Field
cards.text:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you by sources you don't control.
When a card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, sacrifice Energy Field.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
cards.flavor: The mage felt as though he'd been in the stasis suit for days. Upon his return, he found it was months.

cards.name: Exhume
cards.text: Each player puts a creature card from his or her graveyard onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

cards.name: Exploration
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.flavor: The first explorers found Argoth a storehouse of natural wealth—towering forests grown over rich veins of ore.

cards.name: Expunge
cards.text:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Faith Healer
cards.text: Sacrifice an enchantment: You gain life equal to the sacrificed enchantment's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: The power of faith is quiet. It is the leaf unmoved by the hurricane.

cards.name: Falter
cards.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.

cards.name: Fault Line
cards.text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
We live on the serpent's back.
—Viashino saying

cards.name: Fecundity
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.flavor: The forest was too lush for the brothers to despoil—almost.

cards.name: Fiery Mantle
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When Fiery Mantle is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fiery Mantle to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Fire Ants
cards.text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

cards.name: Flesh Reaver
cards.text: Whenever Flesh Reaver deals damage to a creature or opponent, Flesh Reaver deals that much damage to you.
cards.flavor: Though the reaver is horrifyingly effective, its dorsal vents spit a highly corrosive cloud of filth.

cards.name: Fluctuator
cards.text: Cycling abilities you activate cost you up to {2} less to activate.
cards.flavor: Fiko summoned only atogs for three straight sessions. The tutor couldn't decide whether to punish his failure or praise his consistency.

cards.name: Fog Bank
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.

cards.name: Fortitude
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate enchanted creature.
When Fortitude is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Fortitude to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Gaea's Bounty
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The forest grew back so quickly that lumbering machines were suspended in the treetops.

cards.name: Gaea's Cradle
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"Here sprouted the first seedling of Argoth. Here the last tree will fall."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

cards.name: Gaea's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has trample.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: The forest rose to the battle, not to save the people but to save itself.

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

cards.name: Gilded Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Gilded Drake enters the battlefield, exchange control of Gilded Drake and up to one target creature an opponent controls. If you don't make an exchange, sacrifice Gilded Drake. This ability can't be countered except by spells and abilities. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: Buyer beware.

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Once heard, the battle song of an angel becomes part of the listener forever.

cards.name: Goblin Cadets
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Cadets blocks or becomes blocked, target opponent gains control of it. (This removes Goblin Cadets from combat.)
cards.flavor: "If you kids don't stop that racket, I'm turning this expedition around right now!"

cards.name: Goblin Lackey
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: All bark, someone else's bite.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There's always room for one more.

cards.name: Goblin Offensive
cards.text: Put X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: They certainly are.

cards.name: Goblin Patrol
cards.text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."
—Jula, goblin raider

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He was proud to wear the lizard skin around his waist, just for the fun of annoying the enemy.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.flavor:
"It only short jump. You go first."
"AIIIEEEE!"
"Hmm . . . we go different way now."

cards.name: Goblin War Buggy
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavor: The gorilla beat its chest and threw great handfuls of leaves into the air. It howled challenge and showed its teeth. The mechanical soldier, not understanding, simply killed it.

cards.name: Grafted Skullcap
cards.text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your mind. Mine is fitter."
—Gix, Yawgmoth praetor

cards.name: Great Whale
cards.text: When Great Whale enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
cards.flavor:
"As a great whale dies, it flips onto its back. And so an island is born."
—Mariners' legend

cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.
cards.flavor:
"We have more sprouts than they have hands."
—Gamelen, Citanul elder

cards.name: Greener Pastures
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls more lands than each other player, the player puts a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Guma
cards.text: Protection from blue
cards.flavor: When the giant returned for the night, he found a dead merfolk on his pillow. Although he praised the little guma, he inwardly wondered where she had hid the head.

cards.name: Hawkeater Moth
cards.text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Each day at dusk the birds above the canopy grow silent.

cards.name: Headlong Rush
cards.text: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A landslide of goblins poured toward the defenders—tumbling, rolling, and bouncing their way down the steep hillside.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.

cards.flavor: The first Yawgmoth priest to harness their power was rewarded with several unique mutilations.

cards.name: Skittering Skirge
cards.text:
Flying
When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.
cards.flavor: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.

cards.name: Sleeper Agent
cards.text:
When Sleeper Agent enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, Sleeper Agent deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Slippery Karst
cards.text:
Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Smokestack
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a soot counter on Smokestack.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a permanent for each soot counter on Smokestack.

cards.name: Smoldering Crater
cards.text:
Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Sneak Attack
cards.text: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: "Nothin' beat surprise—'cept rock."

cards.name: Somnophore
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Somnophore deals damage to a player, tap target creature that player controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Somnophore remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Songstitcher
cards.text: {1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

cards.name: Soul Sculptor
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Target creature becomes an enchantment and loses all abilities until a player casts a creature spell.
cards.flavor: Does the stone mimic life, or did it once live?

cards.name: Spined Fluke
cards.text:
When Spined Fluke enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Spined Fluke.
cards.flavor: Its spines are prized as writing quills by the priests of Gix.

cards.name: Spire Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Spire Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Sporogenesis
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.
Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it dies, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each fungus counter on that creature.
When Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

cards.name: Spreading Algae
cards.text:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Steam Blast
cards.text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

cards.name: Stern Proctor
cards.text: When Stern Proctor enters the battlefield, return target artifact or enchantment to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I preferred the harsh tutors—they made mischief all the more fun."
—Teferi, third-level student

cards.name: Stroke of Genius
cards.text: Target player draws X cards.
cards.flavor: After a hundred failed experiments, Urza was stunned to find that common silver passed through the portal undamaged. He immediately designed a golem made of the metal.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vapors
cards.text: If a red spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: It was the dragons who first learned to chase their prey into the vapors before igniting them.

cards.name: Sunder
cards.text: Return all lands to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The flow of time was disrupted; like a flooding river it rose from its banks. Tolaria was drowned in an instant that stretched toward infinity.

cards.name: Symbiosis
cards.text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.

cards.name: Tainted Æther
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
cards.flavor: Gix despised the sylvan morass. The gouge that the portal had torn in the forest was the only pleasing sight.

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor:
"The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student

cards.name: Temporal Aperture
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Shuffle your library, then reveal the top card. Until end of turn, for as long as that card remains on top of your library, play with the top card of your library revealed and you may play that card without paying its mana cost. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)

cards.name: Thran Quarry
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no creatures, sacrifice Thran Quarry.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Thran Turbine
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may add {1} or {2} to your mana pool. You can't spend this mana to cast spells.
cards.flavor: When Urza asked the viashino what it did, they answered: "It hums."

cards.name: Thundering Giant
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.

cards.name: Time Spiral
cards.text: Exile Time Spiral. Each player shuffles his or her graveyard and hand into his or her library, then draws seven cards. You untap up to six lands.

cards.name: Titania's Boon
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
cards.flavor: When the winds rock the trees, listen for voices in the creaking of the trunks. If you hear your name, you are one of the Goddess's chosen.

cards.name: Titania's Chosen
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Titania's Chosen.
cards.flavor:
"What do a hero and an arrow have in common? In times of war are many more made."
—Elvish riddle

cards.name: Tolarian Academy
cards.text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool for each artifact you control.
cards.flavor: The academy worked with time—until time ran out.

cards.name: Tolarian Winds
cards.text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Afterward, Tolaria's winds were like the whispers of lost wizards, calling for life.

cards.name: Torch Song
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Torch Song.
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Torch Song: Torch Song deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of verse counters on Torch Song.

cards.name: Treefolk Seedlings
cards.text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.flavor: The year that the brothers landed on Argoth, the trees produced five times as many seeds as normal.

cards.name: Treetop Rangers
cards.text: Treetop Rangers can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"If you can't catch them, cut the trees down from beneath them. Force them to fight on our terms."
—Mishra

cards.name: Turnabout
cards.text: Choose artifact, creature, or land. Tap all untapped permanents of the chosen type target player controls, or untap all tapped permanents of that type that player controls.
cards.flavor: The best cure for a big ego is a little failure.

cards.name: Umbilicus
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.flavor: It was the explorers' only tether to reality.

cards.name: Unnerve
cards.text: Each opponent discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

cards.name: Unworthy Dead
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Unworthy Dead.
cards.flavor:
"Great Yawgmoth moves across the seas of shard and bone and rust. We exalt him in life, in death, and in between."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

cards.name: Urza's Armor
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
cards.flavor:
"Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt."
—Urza

cards.name: Vampiric Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Vebulid
cards.text:
Vebulid enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Vebulid.
When Vebulid attacks or blocks, destroy it at end of combat.

cards.name: Veil of Birds
cards.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veil of Birds is an enchantment, Veil of Birds becomes a 1/1 Bird creature with flying.
cards.flavor: When wind marries sky, even the bride's veil sings her praises.

cards.name: Veiled Apparition
cards.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Apparition is an enchantment, Veiled Apparition becomes a 3/3 Illusion creature with flying and "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Veiled Apparition unless you pay {1}{U}."

cards.name: Veiled Crocodile
cards.text: When a player has no cards in hand, if Veiled Crocodile is an enchantment, Veiled Crocodile becomes a 4/4 Crocodile creature.
cards.flavor: Some roads are paved with bad intentions.

cards.name: Veiled Sentry
cards.text: When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Sentry is an enchantment, Veiled Sentry becomes an Illusion creature with power and toughness each equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Veiled Serpent
cards.text:
When an opponent casts a spell, if Veiled Serpent is an enchantment, Veiled Serpent becomes a 4/4 Serpent creature that can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Venomous Fangs
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature.
cards.flavor: All the pain of the shattered forest contained in a single drop.

cards.name: Vernal Bloom
cards.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.flavor: Many cultures have legends of a lush, hidden paradise. The elves of Argoth had no need of such stories.

cards.name: Viashino Outrider
cards.text: Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: "Give thy ration to thy mount, if the road be long. So sayeth the bey."

cards.name: Viashino Runner
cards.text: Viashino Runner can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor:
"It moved this way, an' that way, an' then before I could stick it, it jumped over my head an' was gone."
—Jula, goblin raider

cards.name: Viashino Sandswimmer
cards.text: {R}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, return Viashino Sandswimmer to its owner's hand. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Viashino Sandswimmer.
cards.flavor: Few swim in a place of such thirst.

cards.name: Viashino Weaponsmith
cards.text: Whenever Viashino Weaponsmith becomes blocked by a creature, Viashino Weaponsmith gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Within the rig settlement, those who have mastered the making of weapons earn highest honor.

cards.name: Victimize
cards.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: The priest cast Xantcha to the ground. "It is defective. We must scrap it."

cards.name: Vile Requiem
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Vile Requiem.
{1}{B}, Sacrifice Vile Requiem: Destroy up to X target nonblack creatures, where X is the number of verse counters on Vile Requiem. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Voice of Grace
cards.text: Flying, protection from black
cards.flavor:
"Opposite Law is Grace, and Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it."
—Song of All, canto 167

cards.name: Voice of Law
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"Life's balance is as a star: on one point is Law, and Law must be upheld. If the knots of order are loosened, chaos will spill through."
—Song of All, canto 167

cards.name: Voltaic Key
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
cards.flavor: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.

cards.name: Vug Lizard
cards.text:
Mountainwalk
Echo {1}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

cards.name: Wall of Junk
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Wall of Junk blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: Urza saw the wall and realized that even if he tore every Phyrexian to pieces, they would still resist him.

cards.name: War Dance
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on War Dance.
Sacrifice War Dance: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of verse counters on War Dance.

cards.name: Waylay
cards.text: Put three 2/2 white Knight creature tokens onto the battlefield. Exile them at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
cards.flavor: "You reek of corruption," spat the knight. "Why are you even here?"

cards.name: Western Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Their weak laws. Their flawed systems. They inhibit the Grand Evolution. In Yawgmoth's name, we shall erase them."
—Oath of the West

cards.name: Whetstone
cards.text: {3}: Each player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
To hone swords and dull minds.
—Whetstone inscription

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Urza tried to rule the air, but Gaea taught him that she controlled all the elements.

cards.name: Wild Dogs
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Wild Dogs.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Shiv hatched from a shell of stone around a yolk of flame."
—Viashino myth

cards.name: Windfall
cards.text: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
cards.flavor:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
—Barrin, master wizard

cards.name: Winding Wurm
cards.text: Echo {4}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: Entire trees were stripped of their bark and branches by the wurm's writhing path.

cards.name: Wirecat
cards.text: Wirecat can't attack or block if an enchantment is on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Its purr is the sound of iron filings sliding down satin.

cards.name: Witch Engine
cards.text:
Swampwalk
{T}: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool. Target opponent gains control of Witch Engine. (Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.)

cards.name: Wizard Mentor
cards.text: {T}: Return Wizard Mentor and target creature you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Although some of the students quickly grasped the concept, the others could summon only blackboards.

cards.name: Worn Powerstone
cards.text:
Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Worship
cards.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
cards.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexia's purity permits no other."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Will
cards.text:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

cards.name: Zephid
cards.text:
Flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Once you've seen one, you'll understand why spells won't go near them.

cards.name: Zephid's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Spells will shun you, as will everyone else.
